issue.title: www.golem.de

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.golem.de/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.golem.de%2F) ### Comment Username: `@felix-22` > This filter from Adguard Tracking Protection: `||cdn.stroeerdigitalgroup.de^$third-party` causes an AD placeholder appearing on the main page (screenshoot 1), it can be proven by turning off Adguard Tracking Protection or disabling the filter by `badfilter` (`||cdn.stroeerdigitalgroup.de^$third-party,badfilter`), which fixes the AD placholder (screenshoot 2). Optionally: `golem.de###iqadtile5` can bu used to hide the remaining AD placeholder. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/gJw0RGq.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | uBlock Origin Browser: | Firefox Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base,
EasyList

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection,
EasyPrivacy,
Peter Lowe's Blocklist

Language-specific:
EasyList Germany

comment.body: The submitter should not be blamed, the problem is caused by AdGuard list, hence submitted to AdGuard tracker, simple, the submitter was not digging into what the best solution is and on which list it should land, it might as well have turned out to be fixed in AdGuard Tracking Protection by excluding the domain or turned out to be some other issue and a different filter required, he left it for devs to determine. Also uBO's policy doesn't fix issues caused by AdGuard lists, why then EasyList Germany would fix such issues, do they fix issues caused by AdGuard lists.

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\

> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/139741

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

comment.body:
Hey @jellizaveta - I've done that, and still getting the same issue.

It looks for now there are three workarounds:

1. Remove Edge from the filtered applications
2. Disable AdGuard completely
3. Use AdGuard with AdGuard VPN

I'd like to note however, if I use AdGuard with Proton VPN or BitDefender VPN, I get the same error. It seems that there's some magic in AdGuard VPN that if used in conjunction with AdGuard, everything works properly.
